text:
Is there a reason current.js is added for EVERY CTA?

can't it just be added once?

maybe it is added because it can´t be assumed that it is already added to the theme in the first place? However, HubSpot is adding a lot of Analytics JS, so i guess it would be more efficient to add current.js once in the same manner.
Gotta be a better way then loading it 16 times :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
For other scripts i had this Idea Post as well: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Disable-scripts-that-are-not-needed/idi-p/599178>
Hello everyone i am kind of stuck with the endpoint to upload files does anyone have an example of a request to that endpoint?
To the files api or the design manager api?

<@UKJSMBW6A> Did you end up finding a solution to ensuring HubSpot's tracking scripts honor the consent preferences stored by onetrust?

I have a client with the same situation. Any way to set preferences for HubSpot tracking within this callback?

```OneTrust.OnConsentChanged(function(consent) {
  ...set HubSpot cookie preferences to match 
})```

Not a good one :confused: HubSpot's support was less than helpful and suggested I just "use their consent tools" to which I replied "they aren't robust enough" and they never responded back.

`_hsq.push(['doNotTrack'])` works to block the data collection but HubSpot doesn't have a way to easily collect the data that was "stopped" from that command in the event that a user provides consent.
Its stuff like this that keep me from suggesting HubSpot as a CMS in place of WordPress or other systems that give you the control you need.

I can’t solve your problem, but what I can tell you is that you have too many CTAs on your page. A page should have one conversion point. If you want to use a cta for that, then go for it, however having a page with multiple actions for a user… like, whats the point of the page? To CTA them to 12 different offers? Its not how it is designed and it isn’t how marketers should be setting up pages.

That being said, adding a button module and having color options / style options embedded into the modules will help alleviate this.

To me there is no reason why you are going to have 10 ctas on a page. What are you going to report on? What are you measuring?
What was the use case for onetrust over HubSpot cookie?
apologies if you mentioned this before, my brain is not remembering

Dude I'm with you. 100%.

I didn't add them, every link in the footer is a CTA :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing: guess they want to track them all?
